artifact.0383.pun.1: Chill out and have an ice time!
artifact.0383.pun.2: You know that ice skater? She's Kate!
artifact.0383.pun.5: An arctic cruise? I can't a-fjord that!
artifact.0383.pun.6: Hey Cole, you're looking pretty cold!
artifact.0383.pun.8: Got a coat? This brrrutal cold's coated me!
artifact.0383.pun.9: Allow me to break the ice!
artifact.0383.pun.10: I'm sending you to the cooler!
artifact.0383.pun.12: This slippery slope's got you on thin ice!
artifact.0383.pun.13: It's snow time to be sitting around in this weather!
artifact.0383.pun.17: They went to the bookstore? I wint'er already!
artifact.0383.pun.18: A heated debate? Don't be so polar-izing!
artifact.0383.pun.19: How about an ice tea for this n-ice tea-m?
artifact.0383.pun.20: Cole the knight had a cold night!
artifact.0383.pun.22: The audience's gone cold? We're just chilling out!
artifact.0383.pun.23: Fishing in the arctic? How about this p-rime sea bream?
artifact.0383.pun.24: A cold lizard? That's just a blizzard!
artifact.0383.pun.25: The arctic's tunes are so cath-arctic!
artifact.0383.pun.26: The ice store's got some cold reception!
artifact.0383.pun.27: Got the cold shoulder? Maybe you should cool down!
artifact.0383.pun.28: Northern taxes? Better pay the pr-ice!
artifact.0383.pun.29: We missed the aurora? How borea-n!
artifact.0383.pun.30: It's snowing out? Would you like my adv-ice?
artifact.0383.pun.31: Build a snowman? Snow way man!
artifact.0383.pun.32: Cold you get me that coat?
artifact.0383.pun.33: Who's hoarding all this ice? Hoar hoar hoar!
artifact.0383.pun.38: Jack Frost's jacked up in this frost!
artifact.0383.pun.39: I hope this igloo comes with a big loo…
artifact.0383.pun.40: A snowman? That all you got snowflake?

artifact.elder_set.msg.idle.low_favor.2: <Erysus> The scent of blood fills me with delight…
artifact.elder_set.msg.idle.low_favor.3: <Erysus> Unbefitting of an elder? Don't say that, I'm just a mirror image.
artifact.elder_set.msg.idle.low_favor.4: <Erysus> You feel stronger? That's good to hear.
artifact.elder_set.msg.idle.low_favor.5: <Erysus> Let's make some flowers bloom in red.
artifact.elder_set.msg.idle.low_favor.8: <Erysus> You're more dedicated than I thought.
artifact.elder_set.msg.idle.low_favor.9: <Erysus> Hmm… *chuckles* I've forgotten what I was going to say.
artifact.elder_set.msg.idle.low_favor.10: <Erysus> You don't find me unsettling now, do you?
artifact.elder_set.msg.idle.high_favor.2: <Erysus> You've been wearing me for a while now…
artifact.elder_set.msg.idle.high_favor.3: <Erysus> I've been feeling happy with you around lately.
artifact.elder_set.msg.idle.high_favor.5: <Erysus> So you still chose me even when I've barely been helping around.
artifact.elder_set.msg.idle.high_favor.8: <Erysus> I love the scent of blood, but your scent isn't all too bad either.
artifact.elder_set.msg.idle.high_favor.9: <Erysus> …You're not thinking of throwing me away now, are you?
artifact.elder_set.msg.idle.high_favor.1: <Erysus> You sure enjoy spending time with such an unsettling woman. Surely I don't tickle your fancy…?
artifact.elder_set.msg.kill.near_enemy.l: <Erysus> You're drenched in blood! Having fun?
<Erysus> What good fun! Killing's the best!
<Erysus> That's it! Keep up that pace!
artifact.elder_set.msg.kill.near_enemy.h: <Erysus> I'd be happy if you found a use out of me.
<Erysus> Let's keep going! I hope this fun never ends!
<Erysus> My favorite moment is the time I spent with you…
<Erysus> Another one down. More, let's kill more…
<Erysus> Ahaha! You got some on you! Better wash it off.
<Erysus> Let's keep killing! You're having fun too, right?
<Erysus> How amusing! It's been so much more fun since you came.
<Erysus> You've already taken it down, let's keep going!
<Erysus> Aww, is he already dead? Next one then.
<Erysus> Don't let your guard down! There's still more enemies!
artifact.elder_set.msg.kill.no_enemies.l: <Erysus> All enemies wiped out! No more left over it seems.
<Erysus> No enemies left, but don't let your guard down.
<Erysus> And then there were none left… *chuckles*
artifact.elder_set.msg.kill.no_enemies.h: <Erysus> Done already? Aww, now it's pretty lonely.
<Erysus> You've killed 'em all. How about a hug for a reward?
<Erysus> Good job, you've gotten them all.
<Erysus> No enemies around! Just the two of us now…
<Erysus> * Your LOVE increased… For me of course! Hahaha…
<Erysus> Take a break, there's no need to rush things.
<Erysus> Aw, playtime's over. Promise me there'll be more, okay?
<Erysus> With the two us, I think we'll make it through any hardship…
<Erysus> Just two lil' soldiers on the field… Think love's brewing?
artifact.elder_set.msg.heal.low_favor.3: <Erysus> Love the feeling of organs churning around in there.
artifact.elder_set.msg.heal.low_favor.4: <Erysus> Hey watch it! Healing doesn't work these clothes you know…
artifact.elder_set.msg.heal.low_favor.5: <Erysus> You want me to heal your lifespan away too? …Just kidding.
artifact.elder_set.msg.heal.low_favor.6: <Erysus> Have you tried healing a dead body? It's quite interesting.
artifact.elder_set.msg.heal.low_favor.8: <Erysus> Give me some attention too! Not that you can fix me anyway…
artifact.elder_set.msg.heal.low_favor.9: <Erysus> If only I could be healed as well…
artifact.elder_set.msg.heal.low_favor.10: <Erysus> If I just inject this stimpack… Just kidding!
artifact.elder_set.msg.heal.high_favor.1: <Erysus> Give me more… Make me feel good.
artifact.elder_set.msg.heal.high_favor.2: <Erysus> That feeling of pain fading away… Isn't it so bittersweet?
artifact.elder_set.msg.heal.high_favor.3: <Erysus> I don't want you to die you know.
artifact.elder_set.msg.heal.high_favor.4: <Erysus> Can't do much when you're not alive, right?
artifact.elder_set.msg.heal.high_favor.5: <Erysus> It's so lonely seeing those scars fade away.
artifact.elder_set.msg.heal.high_favor.6: <Erysus> No amount of healing will get rid of the pain in my chest. How about a hug?
artifact.elder_set.msg.heal.high_favor.7: <Erysus> It's not my fault you got hurt… Right?
artifact.elder_set.msg.heal.high_favor.8: <Erysus> I want to be healed too you know? Don't leave me out…
artifact.elder_set.msg.heal.high_favor.9: <Erysus> I've got a new way to heal your heart, wanna try it out?
artifact.elder_set.msg.heal.high_favor.1: <Erysus> Let me know if it still hurts, I'll help you take your mind off of it. Not that I can do any more than talking…
artifact.elder_set.msg.dmgd.low_favor.1: <Erysus> Woah, are you okay!? Shouldn't we run away?
artifact.elder_set.msg.dmgd.low_favor.6: <Erysus> Keep going, there's still hope left!
artifact.elder_set.msg.dmgd.low_favor.8: <Erysus> It might be best to run…
artifact.elder_set.msg.dmgd.low_favor.9: <Erysus> Just so you know, I'm no passive healer.
artifact.elder_set.msg.dmgd.low_favor.10: <Erysus> You're pretty low… How about you try not to die?
artifact.elder_set.msg.dmgd.high_favor.2: <Erysus> I don't mind dying with you… But don't you die now.
artifact.elder_set.msg.dmgd.high_favor.3: <Erysus> Better patch that up soon. Not much I can do to help otherwise.
artifact.elder_set.msg.dmgd.high_favor.4: <Erysus> Take a breather, we can still do this together you know? Well, I can't heal you though.
artifact.elder_set.msg.dmgd.high_favor.5: <Erysus> Hey! I'm no burial attire you know!
artifact.elder_set.msg.dmgd.high_favor.6: <Erysus> Do you usually like it this rough? How about we save it for next time?
artifact.elder_set.msg.dmgd.high_favor.7: <Erysus> Hey that hurts! …But I'll endure it just for you.
artifact.elder_set.msg.dmgd.high_favor.8: <Erysus> Hahaha, that hurt! That really hurts!
artifact.elder_set.msg.dmgd.high_favor.9: <Erysus> What bold confidence you have with that kind of health.
artifact.elder_set.msg.dmgd.high_favor.1: <Erysus> I can't think of anything cool to say so… Good luck!
artifact.elder_set.msg.equip.1: <Erysus> Hey hey, the name's Erysus! I'm the clothes you're wearing right now.
artifact.elder_set.msg.equip.2: <Erysus> Must be unthinkable to see armor speaking like this all of a sudden, no?
artifact.elder_set.msg.equip.4: <Erysus> It's time for an exciting adventure!
artifact.elder_set.msg.equip.5: <Erysus> The fallen Sage Erysus…That's me alright.
artifact.elder_set.msg.equip.7: <Erysus> Never seen armor talk before? Well I'm doing that right now.
artifact.elder_set.msg.equip.8: <Erysus> Is it time to wake up? Then entertain me a little will you?
artifact.elder_set.msg.equip.9: <Erysus> Let's go, time for another adventure!
artifact.elder_set.msg.equip.10: <Erysus> Seems like you might make things interesting this time around.
artifact.elder_set.msg.unequip.1: <Erysus> Am I too loud for you now?
artifact.elder_set.msg.unequip.2: <Erysus> Bye then, see you next time.
artifact.elder_set.msg.unequip.3: <Erysus> Let's call this a temporary parting.
artifact.elder_set.msg.unequip.4: <Erysus> Well, it wasn't too boring spending time with you.
artifact.elder_set.msg.unequip.5: <Erysus> Are you trying to cheat on me?
artifact.elder_set.msg.unequip.6: <Erysus> I wanted to play some more…
artifact.elder_set.msg.unequip.8: <Erysus> You won't hate me, will you?
artifact.elder_set.msg.unequip.9: <Erysus> I see… Looks like it'll be lonely for a while then.
artifact.elder_set.msg.unequip.10: <Erysus> Next time then! Don't forget to use me again, okay?

effect.0237.desc.1: When fully wearing the garments of earth,
effect.0237.desc.2: regenerate the HP yourself and nearby allies.
effect.0238.name: Stormcaller
effect.0238.desc.1: Wearers of this set become more agile.
effect.0238.desc.2: Their melee attacks also become infused with additional Thunder DMG.
effect.0239.name: Thorny Armor
effect.0239.desc.1: When fully equipped with this set,
effect.0239.desc.2: when attacked, deal DMG and heal 5.0 HP.
effect.0240.desc.1: While raining, or in contact with water, gain
effect.0240.desc.2: Night Vision, Dolphin’s Grace, and Conduit Power.
effect.0241.name: Nocturna
effect.0241.desc.1: While fully equipped during the night, your melee attacks
effect.0241.desc.2: proc an additional attack and heal the wearer for 2 HP.
effect.0243.name: Palesnow Oblivion
effect.0243.desc.1: Fully embrace the frost to slow down nearby entities.
effect.0243.desc.2: Your attacks become infused with additional Water DMG.

effect.0257.name: Newbud Sprout
effect.0258.name: Spirit Symphony

effect.0258.desc.2: in proportion to their Max HP.
effect.0259.name: Reverie of Days Past
effect.0260.name: Siphoned Vitality
effect.0260.desc: Increases Physical DMG based on your Max HP.
effect.0261.name: Gale Blessing
effect.0261.desc: Greatly increases Movement Speed while out of combat.
effect.0262.name: Catastrophe
effect.0262.desc.1: When you’ve dealt %1$s to an enemy, or taken DMG from an enemy,
effect.0262.desc.2: deal non-Elemental DMG to the target and gain %2$s and %3$s.
effect.0263.name: Chivalry of Ruination

effect.0266.name: Blessings of the Earth

effect.0268.name: Macaron Barrier
effect.0269.name: It Hurts! So Sweet!
effect.0270.name: Honey Regeneration
effect.0271.name: Ethereal Texture
effect.0271.desc: The afflicted becomes invisible and falls slowly.
effect.0272.name: Inspiration
effect.0273.name: Charm of Courage
effect.0274.name: Overpulse Armor
effect.0274.desc: Operates at full power when all pieces are equipped.
effect.0275.name: Lunar Boon
effect.0275.desc: Grants an absorption shield that automatically regenerates.
effect.0276.name: Storm’s Unending Cries
effect.0277.name: [𝚃𝚑𝚎 𝚆𝚘𝚛𝚕𝚍]
effect.0278.name: Shackles of Time
effect.0279.name: Poison
effect.0280.name: Clarity
effect.0280.desc.1: Increases DMG dealt and MP Regen, and reduces DMG taken.
effect.0280.desc.2: At the end of this effect’s duration, signs of Addiction start to appear.
effect.0281.name: Addiction
effect.0281.desc.2: Greatly decreases DMG dealt, while greatly increasing DMG taken.
effect.0286.name: Don’t Step on Me!
effect.0291.name: Miner Soul
effect.0292.name: Awaited Opportunity
effect.0293.name: Beyond Speed
effect.0294.name: “Dance” With “Hardluck”
effect.0295.name: Hand of Destruction
effect.0296.name: Severed Soul
effect.0297.name: Ephemeral Reverie
effect.0301.name: Soul Light
effect.0303.name: Celestial Target
effect.0304.name: Pumpkin’s Ire
effect.0304.desc: Increases Movement Speed and grants Night Vision.
effect.0305.name: Darter Poison
effect.0306.name: Reactive Armor
effect.0307.name: Bleeding
effect.0308.name: Healer Trance
effect.0308.desc: Increases DMG dealt based on your Incoming & Outgoing Healing stat.
effect.0309.name: Healer Trance
effect.0310.name: Angel Wings
effect.0310.desc: Greatly increases Movement Speed and Jump Height.
effect.0311.name: Scrapmaker
effect.0312.name: Deadly Poison
effect.0313.name: Firespring
effect.0313.desc.1: Increases Fire DMG and Movement Speed,
effect.0313.desc.2: but nullifies your Water and Thunder DMG.
effect.0314.name: Lightning Quickcharge
effect.0315.name: Charge: %s
effect.0315.desc: After charging, unleash several slashes based on your charges.
effect.0316.name: Combo: %s
effect.0318.name: Arbitration
effect.0319.name: Karma
effect.0319.desc: Take DMG after a period of time.
effect.0320.name: Lethal Charge
effect.0321.name: Bloodthirsty Recoil
effect.0322.name: Zenith Slash - Emitter
effect.0323.name: Charge: %s
effect.0323.desc: Enhances Thunderclap Arrows based on Charge count.
effect.0324.name: Gambit’s Litany
effect.0324.desc: The afflicted’s healing lies in the hands of Lady Luck.
effect.0327.name: Honey Venom
effect.0328.name: Poison
effect.0329.name: Charge: %s
effect.0329.desc: After charging, unleash several slashes based on your charges.
effect.0330.name: Combo:
effect.0333.name: These Muscles Don’t Lie
effect.0334.name: Weaver of End Times
effect.0334.desc: Increases the DMG of Apocalypse based on charge time.
effect.0336.name: Self-Loathing
effect.0336.desc: Decreases Movement Speed and MP Regen.
effect.0336.msg.1:
Wanna know the ugly truth?
No one will notice when you’re gone.
effect.0336.msg.2:
When was the last time someone called out to you?
You can’t remember.
effect.0336.msg.3:
Take a good look at the mirror.
It’s the face nobody pays any mind.
effect.0336.msg.4:
You hear laughter from the other room.
A fun conversation — you excluded from it.
effect.0336.msg.5:
Your favorite places.
Your favorite food.
A feeling you can share with no one.
Isn’t that great?
effect.0336.msg.6:
Ever noticed while talking to someone?
Conversation is nothing more than just a social obligation.
effect.0336.msg.7:
Did someone call your name?
Nobody’s there…
Auditory hallucinations are the first sign of loneliness.
effect.0336.msg.8:
You once joined others in laughter.
Nowadays it’s nothing but noise.
When did you change?
effect.0336.msg.9:
Nobody pays attention even when you talk to them.
You’ve gotten used to the feeling.
effect.0336.msg.10:
“See you next time!”
When was the last time you heard that?
effect.0337.name: Night Vision - Overpulse Armor
effect.0338.name: Jump Boost - Overpulse Armor
effect.0601.name: Sinner’s Reckoning
effect.0603.name: Domination
effect.0603.desc: Your vision is dominated by an enemy.
effect.0604.name: Soulcutting
effect.0606.name: Petrified
effect.0606.desc: Greatly reduces Movement Speed and disables jumping.
effect.0608.name: Drowning
effect.0608.desc: Decreases DMG dealt, Movement Speed, and Mining Speed.
effect.0612.name: Violation
effect.0612.desc: Greatly increases DMG taken and disables movement.
effect.0613.name: Palehex
effect.0614.name: Curse of Hellfire
effect.0615.name: Curse of Torrents
effect.0616.name: Curse of Storms
effect.0617.name: Twins’ Fixation
effect.0617.desc: MG Regen greatly increases while caught in the twins’ sights.
effect.0618.name: Soaked
effect.0618.desc: Greatly decreases Water RES and decreases Movement Speed.
effect.0620.name: Ongaeshi
effect.0621.name: Oathbound Aegis
effect.0621.desc: Greatly reduces DMG taken while an Oathbound Phantasm is alive.
effect.0653.name: C.D. Absolute Drive
effect.0654.name: Chickening Out
effect.0654.desc.1: Things are starting to look dicey here.
effect.0654.desc.2: Time to call it quits right here, right now.
effect.0656.name: Scorching Corruption
effect.0656.desc: Blackwing’s curse foretells a demise in immolation.
effect.0657.name: Chilling Corruption
effect.0657.desc: Blackwing’s curse foretells a demise in frostbite.
effect.0658.name: Thundering Corruption
effect.0658.desc: Blackwing’s curse foretells a demise in storms.
mob.0005.name: Bandit
mob.0005.desc:
A thief who hunts for Shards and Artifacts.
Weak enough to take down even without Artifacts.
This marks the prelude — the start of your long journey.
mob.0007.name: Ectoplasm
mob.0007.desc:
A peculiar spectral entity.
Its attacks can absorb mana, how inconvenient!
mob.0013.name: Cluster Creeper
mob.0013.desc:
An unassumingly ordinary creeper,
but can burst into multiple creepers when it explodes.
mob.0015.name: Watcher
mob.0015.desc:
An eye that watches your every move.
Don’t be mistaken, you’ve already been perceived a threat.
mob.0016.name: Ominous Watcher
mob.0016.desc:
An eye that watches over you with contempt.
Scatters into multiple Watchers on death.
mob.0017.name: Fire Bird
mob.0017.desc:
A flying monster shrouded in flames.
Its attacks sets enemies on fire.
Often mistaken for a phoenix, though may arguably not even be a bird.
mob.0019.name: Priest of Horus
mob.0019.desc:
A skeletal cleric.
What it lacks in offensive ability, it makes up for in healing support.
mob.0021.name: Demonic Eye
mob.0021.desc:
An eldritch eye gliding slowly through the air.
Rumored to have come from another world.
mob.0023.name: Chainsaw Zombie
mob.0023.desc:
A dauntless zombie that charges into enemies.
Its roaring weapon falls silent against the gods.
mob.0026.name: Vena Anima
mob.0026.desc:
A monster born of magical veins.
Its touch can sedate the nerves.
mob.0027.name: Skull Sniper
mob.0027.desc:
While skeletons are well-regarded for their good aim,
this one comes gifted with a sniper rifle over your typical bow and arrow.
If caught in its focused sights, you may want to take cover
mob.0029.name: Skull Archer
mob.0029.desc:
An unassumingly ordinary skeleton, blessed with more health.
Its arrows pack a punch.
mob.0030.name: Warped
mob.0030.desc:
A drowned twisted by mana energies.
While it has an affinity for water, its attacks deal raw Magic DMG instead.
mob.0031.name: Tomb Robber
mob.0031.desc:
A thief that digs up graves for treasure within.
The shovel they wield is also just as good for combat.
mob.0037.name: Conflagrator
mob.0037.desc:
A monster whose touch spreads its roaring flames.
Best to extinguish before it’s too late.
mob.0038.name: Laser Eye
mob.0038.desc:
A mechanical eyeball.
Its high-energy plasma lasers are sure to leave a mark.
You can abandon the thought of running away, as it can phase through walls.
mob.0047.name: Heretic
mob.0047.desc:
A being who defies the natural order.
Keep an eye out for its arrows, which teleports them in front of their targets.
Once struck, they will attempt finish you off with their sword.
mob.0049.name: Frostbinder
mob.0049.desc:
An archer armed with icy arrows.
Their biting cold roots you in place.
mob.0053.name: Executioner
mob.0053.desc:
A duty-bound figure seething in hatred.
Until all sinners’ heads roll, its duty continues.
Teleports when attacking, disorienting foes.
mob.0056.name: Stormdancer
mob.0056.desc:
A capricious monster charged with lightning.
Dances around foes in the blink of an eye.
mob.0057.name: Hollow Warrior
mob.0057.desc:
A warrior born of empty void.
Fights with both blade and arrow.
mob.0058.name: Spreading Mist
mob.0058.desc:
A mysterious mist that spreads when left unchecked.
The mist corrodes to the touch.
mob.0060.name: Volatile Detonator
mob.0060.desc:
Its explosion is inferior to that of a creeper.
Quite fortunate that it doesn’t destroy blocks.
mob.0062.name: entity.minecraft.drowned
mob.0062.desc:
A trident-wielding drowned.
Its weapon warrants making quick work out of them.
mob.0063.name: Wraith
mob.0063.desc:
An apparition that lingers even in death.
While a minor threat, its arrows can momentarily blind you.
mob.0064.name: Arteria Anima
mob.0064.desc:
A monster born of magical arteries.
Its attacks hastens their movement.
mob.0065.name: Nightshade
mob.0065.desc:
A phantom that blends in the dark, ready to ambush.
When you hear its cries, search for its emerald-green eyes.
mob.0073.name: Clutch Spider
mob.0073.desc:
Spits a line of cobweb and teleports where it lands.
With webs that sticky, perhaps many have already suffocated beneath them.
mob.0074.desc:
Throws explosive melons at players.
Why do the melons explode? They just do.
mob.0075.name: Leucocyte
mob.0075.desc:
White blood cells are known to attack foreign substances, such as other players.
Its attacks wear down your defenses.
mob.0076.desc:
Throws explosive gold melons at players.
Its golden explosion carries an electric touch, and packs more firepower than regular melons.
The melon itself isn’t that tasty — it is gold after all.
mob.0077.name: Chorus Zombie
mob.0077.desc: It’s a chorus fruit no matter how you look at it.
mob.0080.name: Gildskull
mob.0080.desc:
A skeleton that’s all gold to the bone,
though rumor has it the gold is just a coat of paint.
mob.0080.head: Gildskull
mob.0081.name: Snow Cloud
mob.0081.desc:
Watch your head — lest an unexpected hail knocks you out.
The cold will slow your movements, making escape difficult.
mob.0084.name: Priest of Falcios
mob.0084.desc:
A high priest under servitude to Tutankhamun.
They chant incantations, summoning powerful soulfire magic,
as well as providing healing support to their allies.
mob.0085.name: entity.minecraft.enderman
mob.0085.desc:
Just an ordinary enderman.
Best to taken down in a single blow while it’s still neutral.
mob.0089.name: Mutilator
mob.0089.desc:
A reanimated skeleton grafted from numerous bones.
Some loosely-attached bones may break off in combat.
It axe seems strong, though its edge is a bit dull.
mob.0104.name: Mad Scientist
mob.0104.desc:
A skeleton enlightened by unorthodox alchemy.
Attacks with an arsenal of potions.
They must’ve got a screw loose in there somewhere.
mob.0106.name: Mini Shulker
mob.0106.desc:
A bite-sized shulker,
yet its strength and capabilities are no inferior to regular shulkers.
If anything, it may be even more of a menace.
mob.0107.name: Dark Enderman
mob.0107.desc:
A enderman hidden in shadows.
Its attacks obscure your vision.
This one’s a pretty gloomy fella.
mob.0114.desc:
A construct of glittering jewels.
It counters ranged attacks with magical bullets.
Keeping them in melee range may suppress their counters.
mob.0115.name: entity.minecraft.piglin
mob.0115.desc:
Just an ordinary piglin.
If you’ve gold to spare, you might get something interesting out of them.
mob.0124.name: Skull Harpy
mob.0124.desc:
A winged skeleton.
It’s able to maneuver itself out of combat,
raining down arrows from the skies.
mob.0138.name: Combat Turret
mob.0138.desc:
A military-developed automaton.
Equipped with a gun that fires a triple round burst, piercing holes in its targets.
Some folks call it a non-lethal taser, but they’re clearly full of it.
mob.0139.name: Blast Eye
mob.0139.desc:
An eye-shaped monster packed with explosive vigor.
While its inability to fly impedes its mobility,
it packs enough firepower to warrant extra caution.
mob.0139.head: Blast Eye Head
mob.0141.name: Honey Marksman
mob.0141.desc:
An icky-sticky archer loaded with sticky arrows.
Getting shot will get you sticky all over.
To top it off, its arrows are laced with a sticky poison.
mob.0142.name: Honey Soldier
mob.0142.desc:
An icky-sticky warrior wielding a sticky sword.
Getting struck gets honey all over you, slowing your movements.
Seems like the sword’s edge still carries a sting.
mob.0146.name: Prismarine Warrior
mob.0146.desc:
A warrior looming in ocean depths.
Poses a considerable threat despite possessing no special abilities.
mob.0147.name: Prismarine Slayer
mob.0147.desc:
A soldier dwelling in ocean depths.
Strikes suddenly in moments of inattention.
mob.0148.name: Prismarine Retiarus
mob.0148.desc:
A monster lurking in ocean depths.
Its trident can cause some serious damage,
though its poor defense leaves it open to attacks.
mob.0150.name: Corruption
mob.0150.desc:
An unethical vice.
Emits a noxious cloud.
mob.0151.desc:
An unethical vice.
It rearranges your genes into a more fragile structure.
mob.0152.name: Greed
mob.0152.desc:
An unethical vice.
Siphons MP to increase its DMG.
mob.0153.desc:
An unethical vice.
Sways the mind, drawing its attention.
mob.0154.desc:
An unethical vice.
Madness eventually takes hold, bringing ruin to all.
It spares none, including itself.
mob.0155.name: Immorality
mob.0155.desc:
An unethical vice.
Fires a barrage of bullets that corrupt the mind.
mob.0156.desc:
An unethical vice.
Obstructs your path.
mob.0159.name: Frozen Guardian
mob.0159.desc:
A guardian wielding an icy blade.
Pursues invaders till their final breath.
mob.0160.name: Frozen Marksman
mob.0160.desc:
A marksman whose bow creates ice sculptures.
You’ll make for great material.
mob.0161.name: Treefeller
mob.0161.desc: A lumberjack that cut down trees and all sorts of things, such as other players.
mob.0162.name: Sheepie
mob.0162.desc:
These sheep infinitely respawn.
Punch em’ for free blocks.
mob.0166.name: Flying Potion
mob.0166.desc:
A potion that just floats.
Guaranteed to contain harmful brews.
Who knew a glass bottle could be so irritating?
mob.0169.name: entity.minecraft.blaze
mob.0169.desc:
Just an ordinary blaze.
Try not to let its flames spread too far.
mob.0171.name: Warped Treefeller
mob.0171.desc:
A lumberjack that reaps souls.
Its attacks lower your Max HP.
mob.0176.name: Killer Bee
mob.0176.desc:
A murderous insect.
Just like regular bees, it takes lethal DMG upon stinging.
mob.0177.name: entity.minecraft.pillager
mob.0177.desc:
A pillager equipped with special arrows.
Nobody knows exactly what is in those arrows.
mob.0178.name: entity.minecraft.vindicator
mob.0178.desc:
A vindicator wielding a lightning sword.
It’s probably just a stolen Artifact.
mob.0179.name: Tridenticator
mob.0179.desc:
A trident-wielding vindicator.
He thinks it’s a lame name too.
mob.0181.name: Arcane Bookshelf
mob.0181.desc:
An animated bookshelf.
Possesses an arsenal of spells for combat,
though seems lacking in any long-ranged spells.
mob.0182.name: Skull Raven
mob.0182.desc:
A winged wither skeleton.
It maneuvers through the air, raining down powerful fire arrows.
mob.0186.name: Fierce Bee
mob.0186.desc:
Bzzzzzt!
Its sting does not contain venom.
mob.0187.name: Flame Mage
mob.0188.name: Piglin Elite
mob.0188.desc:
A merciless piglin brute.
They won’t fall for your bribery.
mob.0189.name: Water Mage
mob.0189.desc:
Well-versed in water magics.
It casts a unique spell of powerful tides.
Take care not to stand in their way.
mob.0190.name: Thunder Mage
mob.0190.desc:
Well-versed in thunder magics.
Casts precise lightning strikes at their target’s feet
They can cast spells outside of your sight, requiring a dedicated search.
mob.0191.name: Piglin Hunter
mob.0201.name: Burnt Dream
mob.0201.desc:
A hunter dual-wielding a blade and crossbow.
The night, and the dream, were long…
mob.0202.name: Hunter’s Dream
mob.0202.desc:
A hunter dual-wielding a blade and crossbow.
May you find your worth in the waking world.
mob.0204.name: Infernal Watcher
mob.0204.desc:
It gazes upon hell itself.
Slowly drifts towards your direction,
but may occasionally enter a frenzy, charging at great speeds.
mob.0205.name: Skull Soldier
mob.0205.desc:
A skeleton that wields both axe and bow.
It uses a bow for long-range targets, but brandishes in melee range.
While fairly reactive, it’s not intelligent enough to control the gap.
mob.0206.name: Skull Basher
mob.0206.desc:
A skeletal soldier that utilizes a quickstep to close the distance.
It shoots from afar as it gets close, while disengaging during melee combat.
That suit of iron has it feeling like a high-class warrior.
mob.0210.desc:
An eldritch eye gazing in chromatic splendor.
This troublesome monster flies around while shooting magical bullets.
It’s known to inhabit an unexpectedly varied amount of areas.
mob.0210.head: %s
mob.0214.name: Self-Destruct Drone
mob.0214.desc:
A combat patrol sentry equipped with a radar.
It charges towards whatever it picks up on its radar.
Carries 25kg high-explosive warheads.
mob.0217.name: Medusa Eye
mob.0217.desc:
It’s said this monstrous eye can petrify any who gets caught in its gaze.
Even if your eyes don’t meet, it’s gaze will turn you to stone.
mob.0217.head: %s
mob.0219.name: Aorta Anima
mob.0219.desc:
A monster born of magical aortae.
As its HP lowers, it will begin to rupture, healing nearby mobs.
mob.0220.name: Vena Cava Anima
mob.0220.desc:
A monster born of magical large veins.
It’s attacks apply a sedative to the touch.
mob.0227.name: Frost Eye
mob.0227.desc:
A monstrous eye shaped by frost.
Freezing to the touch.
Its attacks hurt even more while you’re slowed down.
mob.0227.head: %s
mob.0232.name: Honey Leader
mob.0232.desc:
An icky-sticky leader of sticky colonies.
It shoots a sticky beam and heals its allies.
Best to take down the leader before he gets the chance to heal.
mob.0233.name: Honey Floater
mob.0233.desc:
An icky-sticky floater stickily floating in the air.
Its arrows inflict Slow Falling.
Its stickiness can be felt in the air.
mob.0234.name: WALL-I
mob.0234.desc:
A mechanical eye.
Chases players in its sights, causing an explosion on impact.
Aim for its blind side before it locks onto you!
mob.0235.name: Mandarin Thrower
mob.0235.desc:
Forcefully tries to feed you its oranges.
Try not to get a vitamin C overdose.
mob.0236.name: Jizō Guardian
mob.0236.desc:
A construct of twisted faith.
Attempting to destroy it will incur divine punishment,
so why not clean up the snow on its head?
mob.0236.curse: %s incurred divine punishment for attacking a Jizō Guardian.
mob.0236.favor: The Jizō Guardian repaid the favor for cleaning it.
mob.0238.name: Poltergeist
mob.0238.desc:
Attacked by a set of sentient, hostile armor?
This must be the work of a poltergeist!
mob.0239.name: Poltergeist
mob.0239.desc:
Attacked by sentient weapons flying in the air?
This must be the work of a poltergeist!
mob.0241.name: Poltergeist Abberant
mob.0241.desc:
Attacked by a set of sentient, hostile armor?
This must be the work of a poltergeist!
A particularly strong one at that.
mob.0242.name: Poltergeist Abberant
mob.0242.desc:
Attacked by sentient weapons flying in the air?
This must be the work of a poltergeist!
A particularly strong one at that.
mob.0244.name: Immolating Spider
mob.0244.desc:
Its fiery claws sets its targets aflame.
It can’t burn blocks at least.
mob.0245.name: Flame Creeper
mob.0245.desc:
This flaming creeper will soon set all ablaze.
Its explosions no longer destroy blocks,
but instead scatters flames.
mob.0253.name: Indwelled
mob.0253.desc:
A soldier taken host by a giant eye.
Though possessed, it retains some of its consciousness.
They must surely share a symbiotic relationship.
mob.0254.name: Headless
mob.0254.desc:
An Indwelled soldier released from its eye host.
Freed from the weight of its host, it has become more agile.
mob.0255.name: Indweller Eye
mob.0255.desc:
A parasitic eye that takes host of other lifeforms.
It possesses a strange dependency for the creatures it indwells.
mob.0257.name: Tome of Distortion
mob.0257.desc:
A sentient spellbook.
It can phase in enemies from another space,
cornering those who are careless enough to allow it.
mob.0259.name: Shadow Stalker
mob.0259.desc:
A creature that’s one with shadow.
Hidden in shade, it cannot be perceived by the naked eye,
but light may reveal its form.
mob.0261.name: Laser Eye Mk-Ⅱ
mob.0261.desc:
An enhanced variant of the Laser Eye.
It fires a high-energy plasma ray.
It inherits the function to phase through walls from its predecessor.
mob.0264.name: Dark Summoner
mob.0264.desc:
A mage well-versed in dark magics.
Draws power from a false artifact fabricated from dark energies.
Summons familiars to fight in his stead.
mob.0265.name: Dark Familiar
mob.0265.desc:
A familiar summoned from dark magic.
Casts magical spells while floating gently around its master’s side.
mob.0269.name: Goblin
mob.0269.desc: A common enemy reminiscent of earlygame RPG adventures.
mob.0270.name: Loather
mob.0270.desc:
I hate everything! You! Me! Everything!
Has high jump strength, though hardly makes use of it.
He’s got that vexing attitude.
mob.0271.name: Indomitable Warrior
mob.0271.desc:
A swordsman who never backs down.
This foe’s will won’t be broken easily.
mob.0273.name: Hellblade Bot
mob.0273.desc:
Equipped with a serrated saw, the threat of this guard bot is self-apparent.
It’ll chase you wherever you flee: ground, walls — even through the ceiling itself.
Its unique movement is determined by a complex pathing system.
mob.0274.name: Death Saw Roomba
mob.0274.desc:
It lacks functionality to internally map out crime scenes.
Instead, it’s programmed with a heuristic decision-making algorithm with modes such as:
Collision-Based Directional Adjustment, Hole-Avoidance Maneuvering, and Murder.
mob.0280.name: Infernal Aspirant
mob.0280.desc:
Burn! Burn!
They manifest the desire to burn the realm’s islands.
It leaps away unpredictably when attacked.
mob.0283.name: entity.minecraft.guardian
mob.0283.desc:
Just an ordinary guardian.
It has no other special features.
mob.0287.name: Burning Stomper
mob.0287.desc:
A skeleton that leaps in the air with its sturdy legs.
Smashes into the ground, creating fiery shockwaves on impact.
In addition, it’s heavy enough to be knocked back by light blows.
mob.0292.name: Trample-Bot
mob.0292.desc:
A guard bot stationed in research labs. Electric bursts discharge from its heavy stomps.
A few optimizations have affected its walking functions, making it rely on jumping to move around.
In hindsight, it may be too dangerous to let these loose in the lab.
mob.0313.name: Burning Blaze
mob.0313.desc:
A blaze subservient to the Blazing Inferno.
It bears similarity to an ordinary blaze, but it’s certainly stronger than one.
mob.0321.name: Mini Guardian
mob.0321.desc:
A tiny bite-sized guardian.
Despite the size, its lasers are plenty strong.
mob.0330.desc:
A warrior of auroral lights manifested.
The reaper moniker comes from its persistent desire to hunt you down.
mob.0331.desc:
A mage of the aurora.
It maintains some distance to cast spells from afar.
Whenever it falls, it creates a platform beneath to continue fighting.
mob.0336.name: Sakura Soul
mob.0336.desc:
A spirit that forms where cherry blossom petals fall.
Occasionally stirs up petal storms.
It seems to have already claimed multiple victims.
mob.0363.name: Tome of Palehex
mob.0363.desc:
A white spellbook.
Flies at erratic speeds.
Its attacks leave you defenseless to magic.
mob.0369.name: Tome of Hellfire
mob.0369.desc:
A flaring hot spellbook.
Casts flame spells from a distance.
mob.0370.name: Tome of Tides
mob.0370.desc:
A dripping wet spellbook.
Gets close and spawns a crashing wave, washing away any caught in its path.
mob.0371.name: Tome of Storms
mob.0371.desc:
A shocking spellbook.
Rains down lightning bolts from above your head.
mob.0373.name: Gold Sarcophagus
mob.0374.name: Ashen Sarcophagus
mob.0374.desc:
A coffin shrouded in an ominous presence.
Best to destroy it as soon as possible.
mob.0397.name: Crystal Turret
mob.0397.desc:
A crystal turret created by Ecual.
It may become an overwhelming force if left standing.
mob.0398.name: Crystal Healer
mob.0398.desc:
A crystal healer created by Ecual.
It may become an overwhelming force if left standing.
mob.0399.name: Tome of Void
mob.0399.desc:
A spellbook created by Ecual.
Isn’t it shooting bullets a little too fast?
A trait of the airborne, perhaps?
mob.0400.name: Tome of Combustion
mob.0400.desc:
A spellbook created by Ecual.
Get too close for comfort and it’ll combust.
mob.0401.name: Tome of Darkness
mob.0401.desc:
A spellbook created by Ecual.
Take your eyes of it and it’ll rob you of your sight.
mob.0402.name: Tome of Torrents
mob.0402.desc:
A spellbook created by Ecual.
Best deal with it if you don’t want to drown.
mob.0415.desc:
A skull sniper equipped with an anti-materiel rifle.
Not even the walls will hold against it.
Only you can rely on yourself this time.
mob.0416.name: Ahssat
mob.0416.desc:
The orange-furred wolf Ahssat sprays a barrage of bullets and summons clones of itself.
More, more! There must be more.
mob.0417.name: Skeleton Spacefarer
mob.0417.desc:
A skeletal astronaut.
On top of exceptional physical capabilities,
they can also cross through spacetime.
mob.0418.name: Zombie Spacefarer
mob.0418.desc:
A zombie astronaut.
Strengthened through continued exposure to space radiation,
though not enough to become a Newtype.
mob.0419.name: Drowned Spacefarer
mob.0419.desc:
A drowned astronaut.
Tears a rift through spacetime as it attacks.
Turns out even zombies can drown in space.
mob.0420.name: Blaze Spacefarer
mob.0420.desc:
A blazing astronaut.
Possesses agile mobility and strong firepower.
mob.0421.name: Skittering Turret
mob.0421.desc:
A silverfish with a turret mounted on its head.
Fires strong Skittering Bullets.
mob.0422.name: Skittering Bullet
mob.0422.desc:
A bullet fired from a Skittering Turret.
It’s alive, of course.
mob.0423.name: Spellblade
mob.0423.desc:
A vanguard mage whose blade is enchanted with magic.
As a mage, they possess magical resistance but are weak to physical attacks.
mob.0424.name: Icestomper
mob.0424.desc:
A stomper with sturdy, ice-cold legs.
Every stomp stirs up a fierce blizzard.
mob.0429.name: Killer Bee
mob.0436.name: Air Scatter Mine
mob.0436.desc:
An anti-personnel mine scattered from the air.
Its fuse ignites upon landing and can be detonated.
Loaded with the bare minimum firepower to deter any who trespasses onto this region.
mob.0439.name: Training Dummy
mob.0439.desc: Records and displays DPS after 15s of sustained attacks.
mob.0440.name: Fragile Training Dummy
mob.0441.name: Physical-Resistant Training Dummy
mob.0441.desc:
Records and displays DPS after 15s of sustained attacks.
Boasts high Physical RES, low Magic RES.
mob.0442.name: Magic-Resistant Training Dummy
mob.0442.desc:
Records and displays DPS after 15s of sustained attacks.
Boasts high Magic RES, low Physical RES.
mob.0444.name: Super Dragon
boss.0046.name: Clock of Despair
boss.0046.desc:
A timeless clock that never decays, nor can it be destroyed.
It can’t be defeated through ordinary means.
One can only wait until the Time is right.
boss.0055.name: Hetukedah
boss.0055.desc:
A low-order Angel with large fists.
It becomes particularly dangerous when wrapped in a magical aura.
Wrapped in overflowing mana immense enough to possibly warp your flesh.
boss.0059.name: Jack o’ Lantern
boss.0059.desc:
A peculiar Angel with a pumpkin head.
Its powers are fairly unconvential and eccentric for low-order Angels.
It seems you’ll need more than just brute force to overcome it.
boss.0078.name: Emissary of Storms
boss.0078.desc:
The discordant manifestation of the thunder’s cry.
It moves as fast as lightning and overwhelms its foes with fierce arrows and thunder.
boss.0123.name: Lexiel
boss.0123.desc:
The Angel of Oaths. She would offer even her own life for the sake of her beloved master.
Her rough, rampaging attacks betrays her charming appearance.
Proficient in both swords and magic.
boss.0175.name: Queen Bee
boss.0175.desc:
A high-order Angel — the Queen of the Hive.
She holds no restraint for intruders seeking the Artifact that lies in her nest.
She uses her size to buzz around at unimaginable speeds.
mob.0213.name: Terrible Sonic Bomber
mob.0213.desc:
A combat aircraft fashioned with variable-sweep wings.
Among its arsenal are a myriad of missiles, gravity bombs, and area denial artillery.
Recent advancements have even developed drones ready for deployment.
boss.0213.tips: [ᴛɪᴘꜱ] The Anti-Air Cannon automatically attacks the Angel. When destroyed, it will automatically repair itself, but players can hold %s to hasten the process.
boss.0224.name: Jack o’ Lantern
boss.0224.desc:
A peculiar Angel with a pumpkin head.
Its powers are fairly unconventional and eccentric for low-order Angels.
It seems you’ll need more than brute force to overcome it.
boss.0237.name: Lunatic Magus
boss.0237.desc:
A high-order Angel adept at various studies of magic.
The magic he wields is a cut above what the other mages are capable of.
When pushed to his limits, he calls upon the elements for an ultimate combo.
boss.0301.name: Karmic Kleshas
boss.0301.desc:
The bearer of sin.
As one wracked in sin, her penance lies in death.
Getting hit by her menacing attacks weakens your healing.
boss.0311.name: Blazing Inferno
boss.0311.desc:
The Inferno’s muscled figure is large, and his personality just as prominent.
His tough punches pulverize even the toughest of blocks as if they were made of tofu!
He can also gather his flames into a focused fireball in his hands.
boss.0327.name: Eclael
boss.0327.desc:
One can occasionally catch a glimpse of her drifting within the aurora.
Even while out in the open, she’s often on the verge of dozing off.
Those who see her full of energy must be lucky individuals indeed.
boss.0339.name: Sapphiel
boss.0339.desc:
The coolheaded twin counterpart to Rubiel.
She targets her foes’ blindspots with pinpoint precision, carrying an arsenal of firearms.
Nothing wins her over more than sweet desserts.
boss.0340.name: Rubiel
boss.0340.desc:
The lively twin counterpart to Sapphiel.
She charges recklessly, yet gracefully into battle with blade in hand, playing it by ear.
She enjoys making clothes and accessories in her free time.
boss.0341.name: Louvert
boss.0341.desc:
A high-order Angel wielding a pair of fiery twinblades.
It’s rumored that Louvert’s conflagrating flames can devour everything it touches.
On another note, Louvert is neither male nor female.
boss.0365.name: C.D. Frestchika
boss.0365.desc:
A high-order Angel fused with highly performant cybernetic body.
She manouvers freely through high-power boosters and teleportation.
When she activates her Absolute Drive, she’s able to surpass her limits and achieve her full potential.
boss.0372.name: Tutankhamun
boss.0372.desc:
The name bears resemblance to a well-known pharaoh,
though this Angel is no more than a simulacrum of recorded history and imagination.
It excels in magics and swordsmanship, though it is unknown from where these attributes manifested from.
boss.0376.name: Arbiter of the Damned
boss.0376.desc:
Judge and executioner for those wracked in sin.
To all bearers of sin, he heralds the forecoming of death.
Getting hit by his menacing attacks weakens your healing.
boss.0378.name: The Red Knight
boss.0378.desc: (The Knight’s presence is too distorted to read into…)
boss.0380.name: Haruclaire
boss.0380.desc:
Self-proclaimed absolute-zero icy-chill performer.
Even in the heat of combat, she doesn’t neglect her loveable charms.
Today’s a rehearsal with her best partner Hatoclaire.
boss.0390.name: Outlander Rabbits
boss.0391.name: Axia
boss.0391.desc:
A high-order rabbit Angel.
She swoops down with her greatsword, provoking her enemies for a battle of strength.
Despite her taunting, does she truly only desire to fight…?
boss.0392.name: Ecual
boss.0392.desc:
A high-order rabbit Angel.
Her unique staff allows her to command magic of tremendous power.
As her younger sister, Axia’s often fed up with Ecual’s rowdy tendencies.
boss.0393.name: Labyria
boss.0393.desc:
A high-order rabbit Angel.
On top of her proficiency with her bayonet, she commands a powerful arsenal of weapons to take care of her enemies.
She often pesters Ecual together with Axia in naughty mischief.
boss.0410.name: Blackwing
boss.0410.desc:
Blackening calamity reincarnate — also known by his true name: Heiloang.
Paltry whelp; thou shalt not witness, thou shalt not harken, thou shalt not fathom.
To trifle with the forbidden is the most foolish sin a mortal can bear.
boss.0411.name: Hellflame Drake
boss.0411.desc:
The ruler of Purgatory; the conflagrating tyrant — also known by his true name: Behemoth.
Fools who invite the Monarch’s wrath shall be engulfed in azure flame.
To stop the impending doom, try to take both drakes down at the same time.
boss.0412.name: Tenebrous Drake
boss.0412.desc:
The gelid lord; the paragon of darkness — also known by his true name: Tiamat.
Fools who invite the Monarch’s wrath shall know the chilling terror of darkness.
To stop the impending doom, try to take both drakes down at the same time.
boss.0437.name: Lawless Iron Giant
boss.0437.desc:
Formerly a nameless exhibition in this museum, now the protector of its cursed Artifact.
It’s unclear what makes it so “lawless” but its attacks sure are unruly.
Some of its attacks may be able to be dodged by jumping over them.
boss.1004.name: Tultaria
boss.1004.desc: The harbinger of calamity, threatening the world beyond.
boss.1005.name: Oathbound Phantasm
boss.1005.desc:
A mindless phantasm born from an Angel.
Shields its master from most attacks.
object.1029.name: Spirit
object.1058.name: Brave Knight
item.trader.lock: Can only be purchased at %s%% completion.
island.0.book.tp.p1:
- Teleporter Guide -

When you purify an island, you unlock its %1$s.

%2$s while on it. Your vision will darken, preparing for teleportation.

Align your sights to a %3$s and %4$s to teleport away.
island.0.book.gacha.p1:
Shard Processor Manual


With a Shard in hand, insert it into the machine.

The better the Shard, the higher the quality of Artifacts you can obtain.

chat.tutorial.1.1: A curse has befallen the islands of this realm.
chat.tutorial.1.2.s: You have but one goal: To %s
chat.tutorial.1.2.m: You and your allies have but one goal: To %s
chat.tutorial.1.with: fully rid the curse from this realm.
chat.tutorial.2.s:
Before you lies a %s, the source of an island’s affliction.
You must cleanse the curse that lay within.
Get close and offer a prayer (Hold %s without moving) to cleanse the Artifact.
chat.tutorial.2.m:
Before you lies a %s, the source of an island’s affliction.
You and your allies must cleanse the curse that lay within.
Get close and offer a prayer (Hold %s without moving) to cleanse the Artifact.
chat.tutorial.2.skip: You must cleanse the Artifact. Get close and offer a prayer (Hold %s without moving).
chat.tutorial.3:
When you cleanse an island, you gain a blessing. These items are called %s.
Artifacts are special items that can only be wielded by those who worship a Deity.
chat.tutorial.4.s:
This realm is home to 5 great %s, of whom you will eventually be able to worship.
Through worship, you are graced with blessings and can wield the power of Artifacts.
Though blasphemous, you may change faiths at any time.
chat.tutorial.4.m:
This realm is home to 5 great %s, of whom you and your allies will eventually be able to worship.
Through worship, you are graced with blessings and can wield the power of Artifacts.
Though blasphemous, you may change faiths at any time.
chat.tutorial.5:
%s are scattered throughout the realm, through which monsters emerge.
These spawners can only be broken by slaying the emerging wave of monsters.
chat.tutorial.6.s:
When slain, a %s is built where you fell, protecting your items.
Graves can be harvested through %s.
However, if you are slain before you can reach it, your items will be claimed by your worshipped Deity.
If you fall into the void, your items will be claimed by your Deity with no grave.
chat.tutorial.6.m:
When slain, a %s is built where you fell, protecting your items.
Graves can be harvested through %s.
However, if you are slain before you can reach it, your items will be claimed by your worshipped Deity.
If you fall into the void, your items will be claimed by your Deity with no grave.
chat.tutorial.7:
Lost items can be %s from the Pantheon after cleansing an island.
You may also beg for your Deity’s mercy to reclaim a portion of your lost items.
chat.tutorial.8:
Past this gate, a portal to the %s lies nearby.
The best course of action would be to make your way to it and worship a Deity.
chat.island_purify.title: ISLAND PURIFIED
chat.island_purify.notif: [!] Lost items have been returned to the Pantheon.
chat.tips.1:
Stone has a chance to drop ore when mined, with each pickaxe tier increasing the rate of drops.
Cobblestone can also drop ores, but at a reduced rate and quality.
chat.tips.2: Islands can be cleansed even without breaking their spawners.
chat.tips.3:
Fall DMG in this realm is stronger than usual.
Even with plenty of health, careless mistakes can still be costly.
chat.tips.4: When your items are claimed by a Deity, you can pray for mercy to reclaim a portion of your lost items.
chat.tips.5:
Certain Artifacts have the ability to rescue you from the void, should you ever fall in.
The “Divine Protection” set is one such Artifact.
chat.tips.6:
While trading, [ꜱpᴀᴄᴇ+ʟᴇꜰᴛ ꜱʜɪꜰᴛ] on a selected trade can speed up the process.
 Convenient for bulk trading.
chat.tips.7: Farming crops is a more efficient way of farming currency over wool.
chat.tips.8:
Walking into battle with no armor is equivalent to suicide.
If lacking in defensive Artifacts, the cheap Armor Kits on offer are better than nothing.
chat.tips.9:
The Book of All-Seeing sold by the General Supplier can be used to inspect info on yourself and your targets.
If faced with a foe stronger than your gear, turning back would be a smart choice.
chat.tips.10:
Natural Regeneration remains active even when not fully satiated.
Health restored from Natural Regeneration also scales with your Max HP.
chat.tips.11:
During combat, natural health regeneration is considerably reduced.
When low on HP, retreat may be a wise choice.
chat.tips.12:
You can visit any island at any time.
However, beware of enemies that greatly surpass you in strength.
chat.tips.13:
Many offensive Artifacts come with different cooldown timers.
Artifacts that share the same timer can't be used immediately after another.
chat.tips.14: In the End dimension, where time and weather hold no meaning, Artifacts that rely on it can operate at their full potential.
chat.tips.15:
Debuffs afflicted by enemies can found as %s and %s effects.
These are indicated by the amount of lines in their icon in the bottom-left corner.
chat.tips.16: When up against AoE or ground attacks, a third-person perspective may be a helpful tactic.
chat.tips.17:
Nectar sold by the Potion Merchant is the most basic healing Artifact.
When sparse in other healing options, these may come in handy.
chat.tips.18:
Artifacts that use the Special Cooldown often pack a lot of firepower.
Up against strong foes, these may turn the tide of battle. Use them wisely.
chat.tips.19: For backup wool, food, and Artifact hoards, a %s can make for a smooth journey.
chat.tips.20:
Summon-type Artifacts are effective against enemies that fly freely in the air.
They'll make quick work of them when deployed.
chat.tips.21:
If you find that enemies are difficult to kill, they may be resistant towards your Artifact's element(s).
Try different builds and Artifacts based on your faith and enemy's resistances.
